TITLE: ‘We’re in a housing recession’
SUMMARY: The housing market has cooled so much as the Fed withdraws its support for the economy that some analysts say it may be in a slump.

TITLE: G-7 announces price cap deal on Russian oil in win for Yellen
SUMMARY: The plan touted by the U.S. Treasury secretary aims to diminish the Kremlin's revenue while preserving the global oil supply.

TITLE: Powell’s ‘dangerous’ words risk resistance from lawmakers
SUMMARY: “Jerome Powell’s rhetoric is dangerous, and a Fed-manufactured recession is not inevitable — it’s a policy choice,” Sen. Elizabeth Warren said.

TITLE: U.S. inflation falls for 2nd straight month on lower gas costs
SUMMARY: Despite the signs of moderating price increases, inflation remains far higher than many Americans have ever experienced and is keeping pressure on the Federal Reserve.

TITLE: The Fed is declaring war on inflation. It could lead straight to recession.
SUMMARY: Fed Chair Jerome Powell has pledged to do whatever it takes to curb inflation.

TITLE: The Fed's Powell is squeezing the global economy
SUMMARY: The Fed's interest rate hikes have fueled market turmoil by boosting the value of the dollar and feeding higher borrowing costs.

TITLE: Fed's Powell ignores politics — and may pay a heavy price
SUMMARY: It’s a rare moment for a Fed chair to toss aside all political considerations and ignore frantic investors.

TITLE: Voters pessimistic on economy, inflation as Election Day approaches
SUMMARY: A new POLITICO/Morning Consult poll suggests economic woes are taking a toll on the electorate.

TITLE: Watch Liz Truss announce her resignation
Soaring tax revenue, spending plunge spark record drop in budget deficit
SUMMARY: The budget gap shrank by half in fiscal 2022 as spending on pandemic programs expired and tax revenues surged.

TITLE: Yes, the Liz Truss debacle matters for Americans
SUMMARY: The U.K. political drama will have ripple effects in the U.S.

TITLE: Biden: About 22M applied for student debt relief
More voters trust Republicans on economy as interest in midterms hits high, polls say
SUMMARY: According to an NBC News poll released Sunday, 70 percent of registered voters expressed interest in the upcoming election as a “9” or “10” on a 10-point scale.
